articles.description: A majority of voters – 78 percent – wanted to see more women in office, according to our CBS News exit polls. That wish was reflected in the results. Female candidates won at least 114 races, including both new candidates and incumbents. Author Rebecca Traist…

articles.title: Breaking down voter turnout in 2018 midterms
articles.description: It's predicted that more than 100 million Americans voted in their year's midterm election, with 39 million voting early. In the lead-up to the election, all signs pointed to voter turnout to determine who controlled Congress. CBS News director of elections a…

articles.title: Midterm election was a "report card" for Trump with "split decision," Susan Page says

articles.author: Ed Gove
articles.title: Prosecutors probe "whale jail" off Russia's coast
articles.description: Over 100 orca and beluga whales are being illegally held in cramped conditions, some for several months.

articles.title: Republicans "jostled" after midterm election, GOP strategist says
articles.description: Dan Senor, former senior adviser to the Romney-Ryan 2012 presidential campaign, spoke with Republicans throughout election night and the morning after. Senor joins "CBS This Morning" to discuss their reactions.

articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.title: Election results: Stock market bullishness rises
articles.description: Investors appear relieved that the midterm results are pretty much what they had expected, even the likely gridlock

articles.description: Dan Senor, former senior adviser to the Romney-Ryan 2012 presidential campaign, spoke with Republicans throughout election night and the morning after. Senor joins "CBS This Morning" to discuss their reactions.

articles.title: Nevada Democrat Jacky Rosen flips Senate seat
articles.description: The only Senate seat picked up by Democrats so far is in the battleground state of Nevada. First-term congresswoman Jacky Rosen defeated Republican Sen. Dean Heller in one of the closest contests from the midterms. Jamie Yuccas reports.

articles.title: Eye Opener at 8: GOP's DeSantis wins Florida governor's race
articles.description: A look back at what we've been covering on "CBS This Morning." Subscribe to get the Eye Opener delivered straight to your inbox.

articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.title: Dead brothel owner wins Nevada Assembly seat
articles.description: Trump-style Republican Dennis Hof died last month but it was too late to get his name off the ballot in vast, heavily GOP district

articles.title: Midterm 2018: Year of the Woman is more fitting now than ever
articles.description: The midterm elections were marked by a number of political firsts. A record number of women and minorities won in closely watched races across the country. Paula Reid reports.

articles.author: CBS Radio News
articles.title: WORLD NEWS ROUNDUP: 11/07
articles.description: Democrats take back the House while Republicans gain in the Senate amid a record showing for women. CBS News Correspondent Steve Kathan has today's World News Roundup.

articles.title: What were key factors that helped Democrats take control of the House?
articles.description: Midterm voters reported their top issue was health care, especially among Democrats. It was mentioned by about twice as many voters overall as immigration, the top issue for Republicans. Anthony Mason reports on some of the other key findings from our exit po…

articles.title: Behind the massive turnout in the midterm election
articles.description: CBS News chief congressional correspondent Nancy Cordes and CBS News political correspondent Ed O'Keefe join "CBS This Morning" to discuss the issues that helped Republicans hold control of the Senate and Democrats take control of the House.

articles.title: Midterm 2018: Democrats take control of House, GOP holds Senate
articles.description: An overwhelming voter turnout in this year's midterm elections gave both parties something to celebrate. The new Congress will be divided, with Democrats leading the House and Republicans in charge of the Senate. This means President Trump's agenda will face …

articles.title: With DeSantis victory, Florida governor's race broke heavily along racial lines
articles.description: The Democratic Party's effort to make history in the Florida governor's race fell short, with Ron DeSantis defeating Tallahassee Mayor Andrew Gillum by less than 60,000 votes. In the Senate race, Sen. Bill Nelson is trailing Republican Gov. Rick Scott by 38,0…

articles.title: Georgia's Stacey Abrams to remain in governor's race until "every vote is counted"
articles.description: Democrats in the midterm election found success in the races for governor. They flipped at least four governorships, two of them in states that voted for President Trump in 2016. Georgia’s high-profile governor’s race is still undecided. Mark Strassmann repor…

articles.title: Trump boasts "tremendous success" in midterm election
articles.description: For Republicans, the outcome of the midterm election was better than many expected. President Trump thanked his supporters for a "tremendous success" in spite of Democrats taking control of the House. Major Garrett reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Colorado votes to abolish slavery after proponent receives burned campaign fliers
articles.description: Colorado voters have approved changing the language in the state constitution so that it no longer allows slavery as a form of punishment

articles.title: Eye Opener: Balance of power shifts in Washington
articles.description: For the first time in eight years, the Democrats take control of the House of Representatives, but Republicans gain ground in the Senate. The midterm election set records for diversity. The new wave of women and minorities in office could change our political…

articles.title: 5 nations now demanding Zuckerberg testify on Facebook's data misuse

articles.title: As U.S. allies and rivals react, how might midterm results impact them?

articles.description: Tuesday was a night of historic wins for Muslim, gay and Native American candidates. CBS News chief Congressional correspondent Nancy Cordes and CBS News political correspondent Ed O'Keefe joined CBS Evening News anchor Jeff Glor to discuss

articles.title: 2018 midterms: a night of firsts

articles.title: Stacey Abrams vows that "every vote is counted"
articles.description: Georgia Republican Brian Kemp is leading Democrat Stacey Abrams in the race for governor. But in a speech to supporters, Abrams vowed that "every vote is counted" before calling the race.

articles.title: Arizona race still hasn't been called
articles.description: The Arizona race likely won't be called until later in the week. There are over 1 million outstanding early ballots that need to be counted. CBS News Washington correspondent Paula Reid reports from Martha McSally's campaign event.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Key takeaways from the 2018 midterm elections
articles.description: It was a night of historic firsts, big wins for both parties

articles.title: Sen. Ted Cruz gives victory speech after defeating Beto O'Rourke
articles.description: Texas Republican Sen. Ted Cruz won a narrow victory against Democrat Beto O'Rourke Tuesday night. He addressed supporters after clinching the win, saying he represents "every Texan." Watch his remarks.

articles.title: Florida elects Ron DeSantis as governor
articles.description: "I will fight the good fight, I will finish the race and keep the faith on behalf of the great state of Florida," Republican Ron DeSantis said in his victory speech Tuesday night in Orlando, after defeating Democrat Andrew Gillum. Watch his remarks.

articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.title: Colorado voters elect Jared Polis, nation's first openly gay governor
articles.description: Jared Polis defeated Walker Stapleton to keep the governor's seat in Democratic hands

articles.title: Andrew Gillum concedes Florida governor's race
articles.description: Democrat Andrew Gillum was defeated Tuesday night in Florida's gubernatorial race against Republican Ron DeSantis. Watch his concession speech from Tallahassee.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Democrats win control of the House as Republicans take Senate
articles.description: CBS News projects Democrats will win enough seats to take control of the House of Representatives

articles.title: Republicans keep control of Senate
articles.description: CBS News projects Republicans will win at least 50 seats in the Senate, retaining control in the upper chamber. CBS News' Nancy Cordes and Ed O'Keefe report.

articles.title: Ted Cruz wins tough election against Beto O'Rourke for Texas Senate seat
articles.description: Texas Republican Sen. Ted Cruz won his bid for reelection Tuesday night, fending off a strong challenge from Democrat Beto O'Rourke. O'Rourke energized Democrats in the state, but Cruz got backing from President Trump in the red state. CBS News' Omar Villafra…

articles.title: Democrat Mikie Sherill wins New Jersey's 11th district
articles.description: Democrat Mikie Sherill, a former Navy pilot, has won New Jersey's 11th congressional district, flipping another seat for Democrats. The district had been represented by a Republican since 1985.

articles.title: Mitt Romney wins Utah Senate bid
articles.description: Former Massachusetts governor and 2012 Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney has won his bid for Senate in Utah. He faced off against Democrat Jenny Wilson.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Republicans to hold Senate while Democrats make gains in House
articles.description: CBS News projects Republicans will win at least 50 seats in the Senate, retaining control in the upper chamber
articles.content: CBS News projects Republicans will win at least 50 seats in the Senate, retaining control in the upper chamber.

articles.title: Colorado elects country's first openly gay governor Jared Polis
articles.description: CBS News projects Jared Polis will become Colorado's governor, defeating Republican Walker Stapleton.

articles.author: Caroline Linton
articles.title: Kentucky clerk who refused gay marriage licenses is voted out
articles.description: This was the first time Kim Davis faced re-election since 2015, when she defied the Supreme Court ruling and refused to issue same-sex marriage licenses
articles.content: Kim Davis, the Kentucky clerk who made national headlines in 2015 when she was jailed after refusing to issue same-sex marriage licenses, lost her bid for reelection to Democrat Elwood Caudill Jr. In the Democratic primary last May, Caudill defeated David Erm… [+1215 chars]

articles.title: Ayanna Pressley becomes Massachusetts' first black congresswoman

articles.title: Republican Marsha Blackburn wins Tennessee Senate race
articles.description: Tennessee Republican Marsha Blackburn won her race for Senate. She had support from President Trump as she ran against Democrat Phil Bredesen. Blackburn will be the first female senator from the state.

articles.title: Mike Braun flips Democratic Senate seat in Indiana
articles.description: CBS News projects Republican Mike Braun has defeated Democrat Joe Donnelly in Indiana. Donnelly has been considered one of the most vulnerable Democrats up for re-election in the Senate.

articles.title: Florida ballot initiative giving former felons the right to vote passes
articles.description: Florida voters have approved Amendment 4, which enfranchises 1.4 million former felons in the state

articles.title: Jennifer Wexton flips GOP Virginia stronghold
articles.description: Virginia's Jennifer Wexton has turned over the first House seat of the night for the Democrats. Her opponent, Barbara Comstock, has conceded the race in the 10th Congressional District, the first time in almost 40 years that seat has turned blue. Nancy Cordes…

articles.title: Sherrod Brown projected to win Ohio Senate race
articles.description: CBS News projects Sen. Sherrod Brown will win reelection in Ohio. He was challenged by Republican Jim Renacci. CBSN political reporter Caitlin Huey-Burns discusses the race on election night.

articles.title: Key Texas county to keep polls open an hour later
articles.description: A judge has ruled that a key county in Texas needs to keep polls open an hour later. It could impact the tight Senate race between Ted Cruz and Beto O'Rourke. CBS News correspondents Omar Villafranca and Adriana Diaz join CBSN with more.

articles.title: Judges rule to keep some polling sites open late

articles.title: Deadliest states for drug overdoses
articles.description: These states have the highest rate of drug overdose-related deaths per 100,000 residents.

articles.title: Explaining key election night terms
articles.description: CBS News elections and surveys director Anthony Salvanto explains the language used when defining exit polls, including "toss-up," "lean" and "likely."

articles.title: Florida voters energize around tight governor's race
articles.description: There are 36 states electing governors on Tuesday, including Florida, where voter turnout is surging. CBS News national correspondent Manuel Bojorquez reports.

articles.title: Arizona voters to pick the state's first female senator
articles.description: Voters in Arizona are choosing between two women in the Senate race – meaning the state is guaranteed to elect its first female senator. CBS News Washington correspondent Paula Reid reports.

articles.title: Marijuana on the ballot: Which states could legalize pot?
articles.description: Voters aren't just choosing between candidates this Election Day. There are several ballot measures being considered, including expanding access to marijuana. CBS News correspondent Dean Reynolds reports.

articles.title: What are the key takeaways from Election Day?
articles.description: There are some key takeaways coming to light from Election Day as midterm elections could shed light on President Trump's impact on voters. "CBS This Morning" co-anchors Norah O'Donnell and John O'Donnell, and CBS News chief Congressional correspondent Nancy …

articles.title: How will suburban voters influence the midterms?
articles.description: "As polls close on Election Day, keep an eye on how the suburbs are voting. And races in Virginia, New Jersey and Florida could be key indicators. Anthony Salvanto, CBS News elections and surveys director, joins ""CBS Evening News"" to explain.

articles.title: Ted Cruz hopes to hold on to Senate seat amid tough challenge from Beto O'Rourke
articles.description: One of the key midterm races is the battle for the Senate in Texas. Republican incumbent Sen. Ted Cruz is facing a tough challenge from Democrat Beto O'Rourke, and voters are turning out in record numbers. CBS News correspondent Omar Villafranca reports.
